reviews.review_msg: Sarah is an amazing prof. She is super passionate and cares for her students. The course was tough but it's not hard to get a good grade if you participate and engage with the tutorial readings. She's very approachable and will give great feedback and connect with you during office hours, highly recommend!

Sarah is so caring but I felt as though the actual content was all over the place/hard to understand and only having one in-person 50-minute lecture a week lowered the quality of this course. Sarah is passionate about her teaching and I imagine going to see her more often would have made this class go over smoother for me. (Must buy textbook!!!)

Pro: Passionate, cares about students, available if you have any questions, good TA who also cares. Advice: If you don't understand the material prior to exams, ask for help. You don't need to read the full chapters; focus on the main points and primary sources. Cons: It is very hard to get full marks on papers. Tests: written answer, reasonable.
Dr Walshaw is an okay professor. Her exam questions are overcomplicated and she marks tough. It's an okay class, she barley gives full marks ever.

Sarah is super super kind, lovely, and extremely accessible outside of class.  She really cares about the subject matter and her students.  That being said, I'm not sure I learned anything in her class.  HIST146 is quite surface level and the way content delivered was not super effective in building my confidence with the subject matter.
see below delete this one

Who would interpret: 80 men hung for protesting slow starvation as "justice"; Ethiopia defeating Italy as a "dire ramification" of comparable armaments; colonialism limited by "poor" military performance? Aligns with the single story of European superiority; confusing, depressing, but very friendly & accessible
potential for professorial excellence

Sarah is an amazing prof and I really enjoyed this course. She is extremely accessible outside of class whether it's her office hours or via email! She explains assignments extremely thoroughly as well as course material. I'm not even a history major but I would take all of the history courses with her if i could!

Sarah was an amazing professor! She was always available outside of class to help and was clear about what her exams would be like. Some of the course work can be boring as she uses a textbook, but her tutorials are engaging and if you don't understand a concept, she will break it down step by step. I would definitely recommend her as a prof.

I wanted to take this coarse because I wanted to learn more about African history. Sarah did a good job at teaching and relied on a lot of local African sources which was great to see! She is a bit of a speedy talker though so it can be hard to keep up. But other than that she was helpful, approachable and a fair marker.
Really kind/caring prof. Sometimes the lectures can be dry, but she does her best to help and teach. Great prof overall!
She's ok. Good lectures here and there. Not my go-to prof.

Dr. Walshaw, although vague with certain aspects of feedback, is a solid prof to take. She's accommodating if you need an extension. For some reason we had three groups of high school students attend our lectures throughout this semester. Lots of reading so you need a solid work ethic. Interesting class, but a fair amount of work to do

Dr. Walshaw is a great lecturer, and is very caring. She makes a great effort to ensure that lectures are understandable and that help is easily accessed. Try to get her for tutorials though - found her TA to be very unorganized and kind of lost. Overall, she did a great job with this course and I would definitely take her again! Records lectures.

Lectures related to the readings but don't cover nowhere near as much ground. Focus on lecture material and take loose notes on the textbook. Sort of "up in the air" feeling throughout the semester, didn't feel very structured.
Decent professor. Enjoys the stuff. Lectures are sort of rambling and unrelated to the textbook usually.
Loved Sarah's lectures! I found her interests in food history really engaging, but too many readings for a 100 level course, and none of them were very interesting.

She's amazing. This is a survey course, lots to pack in and boy did she pack them in. She's kind, approachable, clearly knows a lot but is humble enough to open it up to the class and is willing to listen and challenge your views. If you come from a non-arts background, history is a bit challenging in that it's open-ended and loose, so do readings!

Although a kind teacher clearly passionate about African history, her lectures are very unclear and unless you go to class her slides make zero sense. She goes over too much material too quickly without enough explanation. She almost expects you to already have done research before class. Love history but wouldn't take another class with her.

Nice person, enthusiastic about class. But I found her style and organization lacking. It was difficult to write notes when she jumps between topics as much as she does. She wasn't overly helpful when I spoke with her in her office hours. I'd take a course with her only if you need the easy credit, but if you want more, look elsewhere.

One of the most interesting classes I took at SFU. The lecture slides are related to the readings from the textbook and the articles assigned weekly. She is very helpful and listens to students. I would definitely recommend her class and take with her other classes. Plus the TAs are very helpful. Just do the readings. You will be fine.

She's a good prof and really helpful, smart and loves what she does, but talks fast and hard to understand. Her powerpoint notes are useless without her, so don't copy them down word by word because they won't make any sense later unless you write down a lot of what she says too to go along with them. Overall enjoyed the course. VERY hard marker.
Talks a little fast, and exams are quite difficult, but if you're interested in the subject and willing to work hard, it's a great class!
exams made me want to shoot myself. super difficult. this is a first year class....
An awesome course and an equally awesome prof. Very interesting course material and readings. Defiantley not an easy course but was worth it. I'd take another course with her easily.
Really nice! Class was pretty difficult but she was very willing to help!
Great prof, pretty nice and def knows her stuff. Make use of her office hours, she'll really help. Lectures can be a bore and material can seem choppy. Pretty simple midterm and final

A clear and charismatic professor who is very interested in the subject material.  She encourages discussion in class and tutorials and is extremely well organized and helpful.  I'd take a class with her again.

best professor ive had so far, kept lectures and tutorials interesting and fun. quite a lot of assignments and midterms, but overall i really enjoyed this course and hope to take a class with prof. walshaw again in the future.
DO NOT TAKE A COURSE WITH THIS PROF.IT IS IMPOSSIBLE TO DO WELL.STUDIED FOR WEEKS STRAIGHT FOR TESTS AND I BARELY PASSED!
